name: Sub-ZeroGroupConnectedAppliances
0:
”Alexa, turn on the oven light.”
”Alexa, what's the oven temperature?”
”Alexa, what's the temperature of the freezer?”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Your connected Sub-Zero refrigerator, Wolf oven, and Cove dishwasher are now voice-enabled, using Amazon Alexa. Follow these steps to get started:
· Confirm correct configuration and functioning of your connected appliances through the Sub-Zero Group Owner’s mobile application.
· Enable the skill, and you will be presented with a Sub-Zero, Wolf, and Cove account login page. Login using your My Sub-Zero account username and password. These are the same credentials you used to create your original appliance configuration from the Sub-Zero Group Owner’s mobile application.
· Once login is complete, you will be directed to close the window by clicking the “X” in the top right corner of your screen. Then select “Discover Devices.” This process will discover and load all of your Sub-Zero, Wolf, and Cove Connected Appliances into the Alexa application. Note: Discovery may take up to 30 seconds. If no Sub-Zero, Wolf, or Cove devices are listed after the discovery process, please try selecting “Discover Devices” again.

Requirements:
- A Sub-Zero, Wolf or Cove connect-ready appliance
- Connected firmware version 4.9 or higher
- Please contact customer care at 800-222-7820 with questions

Supported Sub-Zero appliances:
- Classic (formerly Built-in)
- Designer (formerly Integrated)
- Designer Wine (formerly Integrated Wine)

Supported Wolf appliances:
- E Series
- M Series

Supported Cove appliances:
- DW2450
- DW2450WS



Get the most out of your connected appliance with these helpful commands: 
 
Sub-Zero:
Here are the commands that are voice-enabled with your Sub-Zero refrigerator and/or freezer. The name of your appliance will be “Fridge,” unless you give it a specific name in the Sub-Zero Group Owner’s mobile application. If you have a combination refrigerator/freezer appliance, the name of your appliance will be “Fridge Freezer,” unless you give it a specific name. You can also rename or customize the device within the Amazon Alexa app device page. 


Alexa, set the Fridge temperature to 32 degrees.
Alexa, what is the temperature of the Fridge?
Alexa, set the Fridge Freezer temperature to 0 degrees. (used if you have a combination refrigerator, freezer appliance)
 Note: temperatures cannot be set below 0 degrees on a freezer with Alexa.
Alexa, turn on the Fridge Ice Maker.
Alexa, turn on the Fridge Max Ice.
Alexa, turn on the Fridge Night Ice.
Turn on “XX” mode; Alexa, turn on the Fridge Sabbath Mode.
 The modes supported are: Sabbath, Long Vacation, and Short Vacation.


Wolf:
There are many modes that are voice-enabled with your Wolf oven. The name of your oven will be “Oven,” unless you give it a specific name in the Sub-Zero Group Owner’s mobile application. If you own a double oven, precede the following list of commands with “Top” or “Bottom” to specify which oven cavity you would like to control.
 
Alexa, turn on the Oven.
Alexa, turn on the Top Oven. (if you have a double oven)
 The “on” command requires the oven be in remote-ready mode.
Alexa, turn off the Oven.
Alexa, turn on the Oven Light.
Alexa, set the Oven temperature to 350 degrees. (requires the oven already be on)
Alexa, what is the temperature of the Oven?
Turn on “XX” mode; Alexa, turn on the Oven Convection Mode. (requires the oven already be on)
 The modes supported are: Bake, Roast, Bake Stone, Convection Bake, Convection Roast, Convection, Dehydrate, and Warm.
 

Cove:
Here are the commands that are voice-enabled with your Cove dishwasher. The name of your dishwasher will be “Dishwasher,” unless you give it a specific name in the Sub-Zero application.
Alexa, turn on the Dishwasher. (requires the dishwasher be in remote-ready mode)
Alexa, turn off the Dishwasher.
